channel.title: Music in the making
channel.description:
Instructional comments and musical illustrations using faculty and students from the Millikin University School of Music. The first thirteen programs in the series focus upon historical aspects of music. The second half of the series explores music's technical side.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Puccini's contribution to opera
item.description: This program discusses the influence on the development of opera that Giacomo Puccini's work had.
item.dc:creator: Millikin University
item.dc:subject: Opera--20th century.

item.title: Choral music of the Classical period
item.description: This program discusses the state of choral music during the classical period, illustrated with works by Mozart and Haydn.
item.dc:creator: Millikin University
item.dc:subject: Choral music--18th century.

item.title: The problem of changing positions
item.description: In this program, Clyde Hess discusses "The Problem of Changing Positions" and violin technique.
item.dc:creator: Millikin University
item.dc:subject: Violin--Methods.

item.title: Percussion section of orchestra
item.description: This program examines the various percussion instruments, like the tympani and the glockenspiel, that are used in orchestras.
item.dc:creator: Millikin University
item.dc:subject: Percussion with band

item.title: Choral music of the Romantic period
item.description: This program focuses on choral music that was composed during the Romantic period in the 19th century.
item.dc:creator: Snyder, Wesley
item.dc:subject: Romanticism in music.

item.title: Early development of choral music
item.description: Professor Wesley Snyder surveys the early history of choral music.
item.dc:creator: Millikin University
item.dc:subject: Music theory--History.

item.title: Pedaling
item.description: This program discusses the technique of pedaling on the piano and illustrates it with music from Debussy.
item.dc:creator: Millikin University
item.dc:subject: Debussy, Claude, 1862-1918. Songs

item.title: Singing as an art
item.description: Hubert Norville discusses the art of singing, from its physical aspects to its technical ones.
item.dc:creator: Millikin University
item.dc:subject: Singing--Physiological aspects.

item.title: Musical form
item.description: In this program, Elizabeth Travis discusses musical form and composition.
item.dc:creator: Millikin University
item.dc:subject: Music theory.

item.title: Gradual acceptance of tonality in choral music
item.description: This program analyzes the gradual acceptance of tonality in choral music, as well as George Handel's role in the developments.
item.dc:creator: Millikin University
item.dc:subject: Handel, George Frideric, 1685-1759. Choral music

item.title: The art song
item.description: This program explores art songs, with examples from Brahms and Schubert.
item.dc:creator: Millikin University
item.dc:subject: Vocal music--19th century.

item.title: Singing America
item.description: In this program, "Singing America," various quintessentially American songs are discussed.
item.dc:creator: Millikin University
item.dc:subject: Foster, Stephen Collins, 1826-1864. Songs.

item.title: History of violin technique
item.description: This program features Professor Clyde Hess looking at the history of violin technique.
item.dc:creator: Millikin University
item.dc:subject: Violin--Performance

item.title: Brasses of the orchestra
item.description: This program discusses the various brass instruments that are employed in orchestras.
item.dc:creator: Millikin University
item.dc:subject: Orchestra

item.title: Puccini's contribution to opera
item.description: This program discusses the influence on the development of opera that Giacomo Puccini's work had.
item.dc:creator: Millikin University
item.dc:subject: Opera--20th century.

item.title: Musical form
item.description: In this program, Elizabeth Travis discusses musical form and composition.
item.dc:creator: Millikin University
item.dc:subject: Music theory.

item.title: Art of composing
item.description: This program discusses the various details that must be considered when composing music.
item.dc:creator: Millikin University
item.dc:subject: Harmony.

item.title: Early development of choral music
item.description: Professor Wesley Snyder surveys the early history of choral music.
item.dc:creator: Snyder, Wesley
item.dc:subject: Music theory--History.

item.title: History of violin technique
item.description: This program features Professor Clyde Hess looking at the history of violin technique.
item.dc:creator: Millikin University
item.dc:subject: Violin--Performance

item.title: 19th century opera expansion
item.description: In this program, Hubert Norville discusses the expansion of opera in the 19th century, using examples from Verdi and Wagner to illustrate.
item.dc:creator: Millikin University
item.dc:subject: Wagner, Richard, 1813-1883. Operas.

item.title: History of string instruments
item.description: Professor Clyde Hess talks about this history of stringed instruments, with a focus on the violin.
item.dc:creator: Millikin University
item.dc:subject: Violin bows

item.dc:subject: Music--Instruction and study.

item.dc:subject: Piano--Instruction and study.

item.description: In this program, Elizabeth Travis explains the use of counterpoint in musical performance and composition.

item.dc:subject: Fugue.

item.dc:subject: Debussy, Claude, 1862-1918. Songs

item.dc:subject: Wagner, Richard, 1813-1883. Operas.

item.title: Importance of the oratorio in choral music
item.description: In this program, Hubert Norville discussed the "Importance of the Oratorio in Choral Music," with examples from the works of Haydn.
item.dc:creator: Millikin University
item.dc:subject: Haydn, Joseph, 1732-1809. Choral music. Selections

item.title: Gluck's reform of opera
item.description: This program focuses on the major changes that composer Christoph Willibald Gluck brought to opera in the 18th century.
item.dc:creator: Millikin University
item.dc:subject: Gluck, Christoph Willibald, Ritter von, 1714-1787. Orfeo ed Euridice.
